rm unsourced trivia item (many editors would probably be happy if only [[WP:IPC]] sections go from "discouraged" to "forbidden")

rv -"disgraced" is a wee bit POV
(I think that there is reasonable consensus that he is now considered disgraced)
rv previous edit against policy - please see [[WP:NOT]] for guidance
/* Laugh Factory incident */ I don't want to be a pain but this section needs to be reshaped to all audiences. Not just adults.
trim redundancy; Emmy Awards already mentioned at the end of the sentence
/* References in popular culture */ I added that Cleveland was black because not everyone watches family guy and understands that Cleveland is black.
specify that Richards show didn't last the whole season
"Fridays - Andy Kaufman incident" link directed to "Fridays" disambiguation page - changed to "Fridays (ABC TV Series)" (I don't know how to make it direct to relevant section of that article)
/* Laugh Factory incident */ replaced ref with ref name, because of already stated ref name
/* References in popular culture */ remove fair use image
linked to CBS news report addressing the timing of Michael Richards apology.
rv intentional violation of consensus. Also please read WP:EL, WP:RS, WP:BLP etc which all explain why blog links cannot be used as citations.
corrected placement of sentence about "also a producer, writer..."
rv Bulbous' rv after discussing it further on the talk page.
rv to previous lead section - consensus for change not reached
restored my edit, after "discussing it" on the talk page.

rv to previous - please use talk page to discuss changes to lead section
OIC...there WAS a comment made by an audience member which qualifies as "heckling" even though it was provoked by Richards' comment.
1. the comedy show was not being broadcast "live" as is implied by the term "live comedy show" 2. it soon emerged that Richards had not been heckled, & only thought he'd been heckled.
edited sentence which incorrectly implied it was 'several days' before Richards apologized fort his racist tirade.
1) Specify that Richards was not actually a guest on Letterman - 2) Source for "meeting" Sharpton & Jackson does not say he met them- he called them 3) add source for Jackson call & radio appearance
Revert: please discuss changes to the consensus section first please.

tweaked the opening sentence a little
give sufficient notice to new editors who may not know what this means
